conclusion: Identify key components: square metal coil, uniform magnetic field, axis of rotation.
Square metal coil labeled abcd with side length L in uniform magnetic field B, rotating around axis OO'.
Coil has side length L and rotates around axis OO' with angular velocity ω.
Axis OO' is perpendicular to magnetic field B and passes through plane of coil.
Side ab is L/4 away from axis of rotation.
Magnetic induction intensity B is uniform.
As coil rotates, angle θ between plane of coil and magnetic field changes.
Magnetic flux Φ through coil at time t is Φ = B * S * cos(θ).
Rate of change of magnetic flux is dΦ/dt = -B * S * ω * sin(θ).
Effective value of induced electromotive force is ℰ = 1/2 * dΦ/dt = 1/2 * B * S * ω.
Area S of square coil is L^2.
Substitute area and distance L/4 to find effective induced electromotive force: ℰ = B * L * ω.
Effective value of induced electromotive force in coil is ℰ = B * L * ω.
